page.title: 06 PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: { The Recreation Ground (cont): cricket facilities.A new sport's pavilion has recently been built through the efforts of the Sport's Association.A BMX bicycle track is being improved at the moment. { Mill House:}Situated off Millgate,the old route out of Masham.It was once part of the 17th century mill.William Jackson was born here in 1815.He was organist at Masham and conductor of the Bradford Choral Society.A family called the Gores live there now. {Old Poor House:}is where the Goodyear family live.It had a prison cell.The administration of the poor was transferred to the Bedale Union in 1854.The cell was then used by the Masham volunteers in 1885 as a powder house.
